meanings.definition: A group of four branches of study in the medieval educational curriculum, including arithmetic, geometry, music, and astronomy.
meanings.sent1: In the quadrivium, students learned about arithmetic, geometry, music, and astronomy.
meanings.sent2: The quadrivium was an important part of education in medieval times.
meanings.sent3: The quadrivium decided to start a band with arithmetic on drums, geometry on guitar, music on vocals, and astronomy on keyboard.
meanings.sent4: The quadrivium of knowledge guided scholars through the vast universe of learning.
meanings.sent5: The quadrivium of studies illuminated the path to understanding the world.
